00011 #include <QGridLayout>
00012 #include <QPushButton>
00013 #include <QHeaderView>
00014 #include <QModelIndex>
00015 
00016 AttributeBox::AttributeBox(QWidget* parent, const QString title):
00017  QGroupBox(title, parent), model_(this), view_(this) {
00018 
00019         // the top layout manager
00020         QGridLayout* topLayout = new QGridLayout(this);
00021 
00022         view_.setModel(&model_);
00023 
00024         // cells are resized to match contents and last column is stretched take the
00025         // available space in the widget
00026         view_.horizontalHeader()->setResizeMode(
00027                         QHeaderView::ResizeToContents);
00028         view_.horizontalHeader()->setStretchLastSection(true);
00029 
00030         // vertical headers are not visible
00031         view_.verticalHeader()->hide();
00032 
00033         // words are wrapped in the cells to minimize space usage
00034         view_.setWordWrap(true);
00035 
00036         // user can only select one item at the time and the whole row is selected
00037         view_.setSelectionMode(QAbstractItemView::SingleSelection);
00038         view_.setSelectionBehavior(QAbstractItemView::SelectRows);
00039         topLayout->addWidget(&view_, 0, 0, 1, 2);
00040 
00041         // connect the signal that tells view if it should resize it's columns when
00042         // data in model changes
00043         connect(&model_, SIGNAL(attributeChanged(int)),
00044                         &view_, SLOT(resizeColumnToContents(int)), Qt::UniqueConnection);
00045         connect(&model_, SIGNAL(attributeChanged(int)),
00046                 this, SIGNAL(contentChanged()), Qt::UniqueConnection);
00047 
00048         // button to add new attributes
00049         QPushButton* addButton = new QPushButton(tr("Add"), this);
00050         addButton->setToolTip(tr("Add a new attribute to the list"));
00051         connect(addButton, SIGNAL(clicked(bool)),
00052                         this, SLOT(onAdd()), Qt::UniqueConnection);
00053         topLayout->addWidget(addButton, 1, 0, 1, 1);
00054 
00055         // button to remove attributes
00056         QPushButton* removeButton = new QPushButton(tr("Remove"), this);
00057         removeButton->setToolTip(tr("Remove selected attribute from the list"));
00058         connect(removeButton, SIGNAL(clicked(bool)),
00059                         this, SLOT(onRemove()), Qt::UniqueConnection);
00060         topLayout->addWidget(removeButton, 1, 1, 1, 1);
00061 }
00062 
00063 AttributeBox::~AttributeBox() {
00064 }
00065 
00066 const QMap<QString, QString> AttributeBox::getAttributes() const {
00067         return model_.getAttributes();
00068 }
00069 
00070 bool AttributeBox::isValid() const {
00071         return model_.validAttributes();
00072 }
00073 
00074 void AttributeBox::onAdd() {
00075 
00076         // create the dialog to input a new name-value-pair
00077         AttributeDialog dialog(this);
00078 
00079         // execute the dialog
00080         AttributeDialog::Attribute* attribute = dialog.exec();
00081 
00082         // if user did not input anything
00083         if (!attribute) {
00084                 return;
00085         }
00086 
00087         // add the attribute to the model
00088         model_.addAttribute(attribute->name_, attribute->value_);
00089 
00090         // inform that contents has changed
00091         emit contentChanged();
00092 
00093         // delete the temporary attribute created by the dialog
00094         delete attribute;
00095 }
00096 
00097 void AttributeBox::onRemove() {
00098         model_.removeAttribute(view_.currentIndex());
00099 
00100         // inform that contents has changed
00101         emit contentChanged();
00102 }
00103 
00104 void AttributeBox::setAttributes(const QMap<QString, QString>& attributes) {
00105         model_.setAttributes(attributes);
00106 }
00107 
00108 void AttributeBox::clear() {
00109         model_.clear();
00110 }
00111 
00112 bool AttributeBox::isEmpty() const {
00113         return (model_.rowCount() == 0);
00114 }
